bug.author: valeriano-manassero
bug.description:
I got a microk8s 1.13 on Ubuntu 8.04 LTS. On the host I have: NVIDIA-SMI 410.104 Driver Version: 410.104 CUDA Version: 10.0 I enabled gpu on microk8s and deployed Kubeflow v 0.5.0 I started a notebook with image tensorflow-1.13.1-notebook-gpu and everything is ok. If I try to use image tensorflow-2.0.0a-notebook-gpu and I got this issue when import tensorflow as tf This is the error: <denchmark-code>ImportError: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/conda/envs/py2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 58, in <module> from tensorflow.python.pywrap_tensorflow_internal import * File "/opt/conda/envs/py2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow_internal.py", line 28, in <module> _pywrap_tensorflow_internal = swig_import_helper() File "/opt/conda/envs/py2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow_internal.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow_internal', fp, pathname, description) ImportError: libcublas.so.10.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory </denchmark-code>
I'm confused since two images should share same base: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zabbasi/kubeflow/blob/master/components/tensorflow-notebook-image/versions/2.0.0a0gpu/version-config.json>https://github.com/zabbasi/kubeflow/blob/master/components/tensorflow-notebook-image/versions/2.0.0a0gpu/version-config.json</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zabbasi/kubeflow/blob/master/components/tensorflow-notebook-image/versions/1.13.1gpu/version-config.json>https://github.com/zabbasi/kubeflow/blob/master/components/tensorflow-notebook-image/versions/1.13.1gpu/version-config.json</denchmark-link>
Any clue?

I have the same thing using this image on GCP.

I have the same thing using this image on kubernetes cluster <denchmark-h:h3>k8s: 1.14.3, kubeflow: 0.5.0</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>GPU node info</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>> cat /etc/centos-release CentOS Linux release 7.4.1708 (Core) > uname -a Linux nb-lab-aitest1 3.10.0-693.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Aug 22 21:09:27 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
> /usr/local/cuda-10.0/bin/nvcc --version nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver Copyright (c) 2005-2018 NVIDIA Corporation Built on Sat_Aug_25_21:08:01_CDT_2018 Cuda compilation tools, release 10.0, V10.0.130 > /usr/local/cuda-10.1/bin/nvcc --version nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver Copyright (c) 2005-2019 NVIDIA Corporation Built on Wed_Apr_24_19:10:27_PDT_2019 Cuda compilation tools, release 10.1, V10.1.168 > /usr/local/cuda/bin/nvcc --version nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver Copyright (c) 2005-2019 NVIDIA Corporation Built on Wed_Apr_24_19:10:27_PDT_2019 Cuda compilation tools, release 10.1, V10.1.168 </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-code>> docker version Client: Version: 18.06.3-ce API version: 1.38 Go version: go1.10.3 Git commit: d7080c1 Built: Wed Feb 20 02:26:51 2019 OS/Arch: linux/amd64 Experimental: false
Server: Engine: Version: 18.06.3-ce API version: 1.38 (minimum version 1.12) Go version: go1.10.3 Git commit: d7080c1 Built: Wed Feb 20 02:28:17 2019 OS/Arch: linux/amd64 Experimental: false

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/valeriano-manassero>@valeriano-manassero</denchmark-link> did you make progress on this ?

@valeriano-manassero did you make progress on this ?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jbottum>@jbottum</denchmark-link> I'm currently using a custom image I created. Since I was thinking new images were coming up fast with new versions of TF, I didn't prepared anything to share. A quick workaround is to start with image tensorflow-1.13.1-notebook-gpu, create a new notebook and, in the first cell, put and execute: !pip install -U tensorflow-gpu==2.0.0rc1
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
